abstract.p: In this paper we generalize the classical Proth's theorem and the Miller-Rabin test for integers of the form $\mathrm{N}=\text{\hspace{0.17em}}\mathrm{K}{\mathrm{p}}^{\mathrm{n}}+\text{\hspace{0.17em}}1$. For these families, we present variations on the classical Pocklington's results and, in particular, a primality test whose computational complexity is Õ(log² N) and, what is more important, that requires only one modular exponentiation modulo N similar to that of Fermat's test.
